entry.et: Middle English marien, from Anglo-French marier, from Latin maritare, from maritus married

def.dt: :to join in marriage according to law or custom
:to give in marriage married his daughter to his partner's son
:to take as spouse :wed married the girl next door
:to perform the ceremony of marriage for a priest will marry them
:to unite in close and usually permanent relation
:combine unite seafood marries with other flavors
:to become a member of by marriage married into a prominent family

entry.et: Middle English marie, from Marie, the Virgin Mary

dt.un: used for emphasis and especially to express amused or surprised agreement
